1. Creating Store Group & Scenario:

- Create store group for the country from UI as “XX-Stores”, choose dynamic option for saveType
- Share it with authorized users only.
- Create “XX_AllinOne“ scenario by using the store group all stores will be locate in one region
- Create “XX_Default“ scenario by using the store group, check if it has a specific rule like Spain. Canarias stores are located in a different region → if you have a rule to differentiate regions then pls create those stores as a seperate region in Default scenario and add those stores to huguobossreporting.[dbo].[OnlyWithinRegionStores] with related region name

2. add Country XX to scope

content:
guobossreporting.[dbo].[OnlyWithinRegionStores] with related region name

2. add Country XX to scope

- Add your country into hugobossreporting.[dbo].[CountriesInScope]
- Check the warehouse mapping in the system → hugobossreporting.[dbo].[MAPPING_CountryWH]. IF the mapping is not correct, correct  it  in here and in the mapping documen in teams. (if two warehouse exist then add it as two rows)
- Fill [transfer].[WarehouseStoreProductRelations]

3. Check parameter tables if your country is added by the client of not

- [report].[TransferLeadTime][report].[TransferShipmentConstraints][data].[BlockedDestinations][data].[BlockedOrigins][data].[BlockedStores]If not check related teams file

4. Start a new run in the UI - test your country transfer results

- What should we do to include NOS products to run scope?

NOS Products are blocked as product-store pairs. User should select the ignore blocked pairs parameter to include NOS products to run scope. Since NOS products usually have inventory at warehouses, it is preferred to select higher values for the warehouse inventory limit parameter when they are included to a run. Select NOS products form Is NOS filter while creating product group.

- Any recommendations for End-of-Season runs?

ucts form Is NOS filter while creating product group.

- Any recommendations for End-of-Season runs?

For End-of-Season (EOS) runs, we recommend client to increase the forecast interval week and decrease the size distribution rule. Usually, they don’t prefer to do transfers during end of season periods, longer cover period supports this.

- Why is the transfer result equal to 0? (or total transfer amount is low?)

We encourage client to check the Contrained Transfer Decisions report. For most of the cases, the results are eliminated due to shipment contraints.

- Priorization of stores: The sales history of more recent weeks is weighted higher than the sales further in the past
- Returns: are not considered Example: week 1 - 2 units sold, week 2 - 1 unit returned => tool considers 2 units sold, report: 1 unit sold
- Do I need to set up Store groups by BM? You can select all stores of the country (even if I only want to transfer Boss Woman)
- Threshold for broken size ranges Calculate based on sales in the past year on country level:  Net Units sold - Style/color/ country level for the last 12 months => sizes in percent of total Net Units sold for this S/C If it is below the threshold (e.g. 70%), it is considered as broken
- Why are my blocked stores not applied correctly? => please use the "XX_default" scenario => here the blocked stores are applied If you want to create own scenarios, which you need to use frequently => contract Eda This applies to store scenarios - not store groups!

which you need to use frequently => contract Eda This applies to store scenarios - not store groups!
- Repeated styles Some styles, which are offered in several collections, might switch to W22 (while still on mark down for SR22) Block manually in parameter file (scheduled runs) or in product scenarios Once article lists will be available as filter: you may exclude the SR22 mark down lists from FW22 runs
- Approval date Please always approve at the day, when you send it out to the stores! Otherwise the send outs it would not be considered in the calculation of the "execution rate"
- Prequel run If you suppose that there are still a lot of units, which the stores have not yet executed, you may use this function Decreases units on stock of the origin sites, considered as in transit for destination e.g. if the same brand module is done twice in the same week "duplicated pairs" check the last 7 days => export, check, remove in approval screen if valid

e week "duplicated pairs" check the last 7 days => export, check, remove in approval screen if valid
- How can I exclude tailored line? Use "product segment"
- How do I filter on NOS products? Select filter "is NOS" & select "1" 0 - product is not an NOS 1 - product is an NOS
- The clearance run: tool did not propose all units on stock => please remove the restrictions! (ignore blocked pairs & ignore blocked products)Plus "ignore size distribution rules" "Ignore blocked pairs"  careful: it could happen that a BM style would be sent to an e.g. Hugo store! It is both, destination & origin Sales history is of course still needed in destination store
- Download to excel In order to repeat the data in new lines in downloaded excel,  You have to select -> Download -> Crosstab -> CSV (in format type)

- REPORTINGExecution rate:  considers transfer in into receiving site  We will discuss with IT whether we may provide additionally a "send out rate" to track if sending stores have completed the send outs Only executed transfers are considered to calculate the add sales ratio  => a lower exucution rate does not automatically lead to a low Add. Sales ratio Manual trasfer ratio: transfers to outlet and blocked stores excluded (client orders to be checked) Manual Transfer Ratio By default, decision type = Invent. This leads to zero manual transfer ratios in the approved runs

o By default, decision type = Invent. This leads to zero manual transfer ratios in the approved runs. Because the additions are not labeled as Invent Suggestion since the suggested quantity=0  Manual transfers- definition Not initiated by invent tool All transfers shown (same as Del Mon transfer report) Only the executed transfers = received in destination Excluded Blocked stores (see excel file) => dashboard to be checked Transfers with only 1 unit Blockage Filter  Time dependent KPI blockage filter is now available in the KPI Dashboard. Basically it filters out the stores that are blocked in our system at the time when the run is started. Lead Time Reporting From now on, the time passed for transfer executions are available in the KPI Overall Summary report. As we have discussed, it is a calculation weighted by transfer quantity and the basic formulas are as follows:

Actual Source Lead Time : Departure Date - Approved Date

ity and the basic formulas are as follows:

Actual Source Lead Time : Departure Date - Approved Date

Actual In Transit Lead Time: Received Date - Departure Date

Actual Total Lead Time : Received Date - Approved Date

Input DataDaily input files will be found under inventhugobossshared/input/history/EMEA (or APAC or NCSA) folder.Please see: Sample daily filesInput Parameters: Please see HB_parameter_setting. Key Users can change some of the inputs from the Data Input folder. (Sample Input Parameters folder)Input parameters are expected to be changed from Parameter Screens (UI) soon.Data Mapping: link (Sample data mapping file)Custom UI Parameters: Warehouse Inventory Limit, Apply Shipment Constraints, Ignore IA ScopeOutput DataRun outputs are not automatically transferred to client buckets. It is key users responsibility to export the results from the ui and entegrate suggestions to their system. The column of the results csv file was decided with the client. Please see: Sample output csv fileTo track KPIs accurately, we expect key users to approve the runs when they will transfer the suggestions

ack KPIs accurately, we expect key users to approve the runs when they will transfer the suggestions. Unapproved runs are considered as test runs.Special CasesClient Specific Terminologies: Style Color = OptionStyle Color Size = Product (SKU)Site = StoreSize Distribution Rule = Broken Assortment RuleConsolidation = TransferSpecial Days: Christmas period should be ignored from ignore table to avoid forecast fluctuation.Special Rules: NOS Products are blocked as product-store pairs. User should select the ignore blocked pairs parameter to include NOS products to run scope. Since NOS products usually have inventory at warehouses, it is preferred to select higher values for the warehouse inventory limit parameter when they are included to a run. NOS products are included/excluded from the run scopes from product group creation filters.We are blocking transfer between some stores by using transfer.manualorders table

p creation filters.We are blocking transfer between some stores by using transfer.manualorders table. Client sends leadtime greater than 30 days when they don’t want a store to send products to another spesific store. (SP: etl.UpdateRuleTables)Pairs are eliminated from run scopes if they are not in initial allocation scope. (Except stock consolidation runs)For broken assortment rule, size weights are calculation based on last one year sales for each country. Before each run, broken assortment rule table is updated with tha data of the related country.Warehouse inventory limit is calculated based on the size weights

th tha data of the related country.Warehouse inventory limit is calculated based on the size weights. Each productcodes stocks is multiplied by its size weight and optioncodes are eliminated from the run scope when an option has more inventoey at the warehouse than the warehouse inventory limit.Transfer results are deleted based on shipment constraints in the manual post-process.Capacity transfer run type is not implemented.Key users can only have access to the countries they are responsible from. We define country based user restriction from user management.(ui)Default scenarios are generated daily for each country to consider blockages dynamically. Extensions:Each region has different ETL flow and ETL start time.Every Sunday, client sends data of Saturdays sales as missing. - ETL starts 3 times a day, for each region. (EMEA, SEAPAC, NCSA)
- Airflow triggers the daily dag at 03:15 a.m., first EMEA ETL starts. At 11:35 a.m.,  NCSA ETL starts. Then the dag waits until 18:15 to start ETL part for SEAPAC.

- Client sends files with ftp server. Path: prod/regional/upload/”region”/”date” (Host: eftp.hugoboss.com) . Sent files are copied to inventhugobossshared/input/history/”region”/”date” (Azure Storage)

- Client sends NCSA files around 11:30 a.m., EMEA 04:15 a.m., APAC 19:15 p.m.

This development, requested by clients to prioritize certain stores in performance transfer runs, is specifically designed to achieve this prioritization during performance runs.

Users can enter the store codes they wish to prioritize.
 Prioritized stores will appear on the run details page.

If no stores are prioritized, the display will appear as shown below.

This prioritization feature has been implemented by adjusting the distance values between stores.
Distance calculations are based on lead times, which users can input through the parameters screen.
The lead time values are set to 7 by default, but they are adjusted to 0 for the destination points.
This process is carried out during both the pre-processing and post-processing stored procedures.

Future Runs

Customers create future runs in the morning to handle the first job results, but future runs are triggered only after the data transfer for each region has been successfully completed. If there is an issue with the data transfer on that day, they are not triggered. The SP that triggers this is [transfer].[ExecuteFutureTransferRuns].

This feature is mostly used by the NCSA region, and sometimes they send an email if the run hasn't been triggered by the start of their business hours. This situation depends on the successful completion of the data transfer.

Status 5 is a future run.

Answer: We check the status of the run through engine.algoruns, and to make a hidden run visible in the interface, we change its status to 2.

SELECT
	 s.session_id s_id
    ,s.login_name
    ,r.STATUS
    ,r.blocking_session_id 'blck'
    ,r.wait_type
    --,wait_resource
    ,cast(r.wait_time / (60000.0) as decimal(18,2)) 'waitM'
    ,r.cpu_time
    ,r.logical_reads
    ,r.reads
    ,r.writes
    ,cast(r.total_elapsed_time / (60000.0) as decimal(18,2)) 'elpsdM'
	,Db_name(st.dbid) DBName
    ,Coalesce(Quotename(Db_name(st.dbid)) + N'.' + Quotename(Object_schema_name(st.objectid, st.dbid)) + N'.' + Quotename(Object_name(st.objectid, st.dbid)), '') AS command_text
    ,Substring(st.TEXT, (r.statement_start_offset / 2) + 1, (
            (
                CASE r.statement_end_offset
                    WHEN - 1
                        THEN Datalength(st.TEXT)
                    ELSE r.statement_end_offset
                    END - r.statement_start_offset
                ) / 2
            ) + 1) AS statement_text
    ,r.command
    ,s.host_name
    ,s.program_name
    ,s.host_process_id
    ,s.last_request_end_time

,r.command
    ,s.host_name
    ,s.program_name
    ,s.host_process_id
    ,s.last_request_end_time
    ,s.login_time
    ,r.open_transaction_count
FROM sys.dm_exec_sessions AS s
INNER JOIN sys.dm_exec_requests AS r ON r.session_id = s.session_id
CROSS APPLY sys.dm_exec_sql_text(r.sql_handle) AS st
WHERE 1 = 1
	AND r.session_id != @@SPID
	AND ISNULL(s.login_name, '') <> 'telegraf'
ORDER BY r.cpu_time DESC
    ,r.STATUS
    ,r.blocking_session_id
    ,s.session_id

Made an Announcement on 12th of February 2025Title: Clarification on Initial Allocation Scope

Dear DDIT Users,

We hope you are doing well.

We would like to address some of the questions we have received regarding initial allocation scope during seasonal transitions.

We have received emails indicating that, although certain product-store pairs are within scope, they are being excluded due to not being within the initial allocation scope. To clarify, we receive daily data transfers containing information about in-scope product-store pairs. The data includes season details for each pair, and if a product-store pair is not defined for the current season (for example SS25) in the provided data, it is excluded from the initial allocation scope.

nt season (for example SS25) in the provided data, it is excluded from the initial allocation scope.

This issue frequently arises during seasonal transitions. For instance, if a product is a winter item, it is excluded in the next season if its updated season data is not included in the transferred data.

To prevent this issue, there are two possible solutions:

1- Ensuring that product-store pairs are sent with the current season information (for example SS25) in the data provided to us. Since modifying the code to automatically include them in the next season could introduce unintended out-of-scope product-store pairs, we cannot proceed with this way.

2- Scope Additions

You can use this screen to add a product-code/product group and store-code/store group pair to the scope. This way, newly added product-store pairs will not be eliminated due to the initial allocation scope

UI Authorization

There are three steps we follow when granting access to the interface:

1. We request an email address starting with "e" from the hugoboss user.
2. We grant access based on the country filter corresponding to the user's responsible country, mostly as senior user but we will ask also the role.
3. We add the user to the store group(formatted as [Country Abbreviation]Stores[Number]) of that country, then record their name, surname, and email address in the users list.

When users initiate a run, if it fails, we will send an email via this recording.

### HUGO Data Transfer and ETL Process

In the daily flow, some tasks are triggered once per day, while others are executed three times—once for each region.

The stored procedure (SP) that runs once per day is triggered after the Refresh Maps Report Daily successfully completes execution in all three regions. This process executes the
 `EXEC report.GenerateReportCaches` stored procedure.

Within this stored procedure, the following updates occur once per day:

rtCaches` stored procedure.

Within this stored procedure, the following updates occur once per day:

- ItemInformationCache: Updates the product data displayed in the interface.
- StoresInformationCache: Updates store-related data.
- PairsAggregation: Updates product-store pair information.
- Broken Assortment Weights Calculation: Computes broken assortment weights for all countries.
- Transfer Sales Return Report Update: Updates the Transfer Sales Return Report after these processes.

The execution sequence of stored procedures is as follows:

les Return Report after these processes.

The execution sequence of stored procedures is as follows:

`EXEC [etl].[ExecuteProcedureAndLogSteps] '[etl].[UpdateUITables]' -- Exclude products in UI before ItemInfo EXEC [etl].[ExecuteProcedureAndLogSteps] '[transfer].[SetItemsInformationCacheV2]' -- Standard EXEC [etl].[ExecuteProcedureAndLogSteps] '[transfer].[SetStoresInformationCache]' -- Standard EXEC [etl].[ExecuteProcedureAndLogSteps] '[transfer].[SetPairsAggregatedCache]' -- Standard EXEC [etl].[ExecuteProcedureAndLogSteps] '[etl].[CalculateBrokenAssortmentWeights]' -- Compute broken assortment weights for all countries EXEC [etl].[ExecuteProcedureAndLogSteps] '[report].[TransferSalesReturn]' -- Generate transfer sales return`

The time spent on each step is analyzed using this table. When making improvements, the steps with longer durations can be identified, and optimizations can be made in stored procedures (SPs) that take excessive time.

### Core Calculation Flow:

CoverPeriod = ReviewTime + AdditionalTime + LeadTime

This is the total time covering order creation and delivery.

- The Additional Time value is determined through discussions with the client or internal teams.

### Use of Additional Time

`additional_time` is an extra time parameter defined based on the needs of specific product groups or channels.

_time` is an extra time parameter defined based on the needs of specific product groups or channels.

- For example, channels like John Lewis that aim to hold limited stock are assigned a value of 0, while others may receive values like 3 or 7.
- It is defined via the UI and can also be updated by the client.Example: The Outlet team has increased their weekly cover period.
- Initial definitions were made in offline meetings, and some were fixed via client-approved emails.

---

### Mismatch Between target_initial and Sum of safety_stock + cover_period_forecast

In target calculations, when the sum of `cover_period_forecast (CPFC)` and `safety_stock` is less than 1, the system enforces a minimum order threshold and sets the total to 1.

- As a result, in some cases, the value of target_modified__target_initial might appear higher than the sum of CPFC + Safety Stock.
- This mechanism prevents the system from treating the demand as zero and avoids unnecessary lost sales.

During analysis, some discrepancies were found between `target` and the sum of `cover_period_forecast + safety_stock`.

### Min 1 – Max 16 Target Values in the Sports Category

- Although having min target = 1 and max target = 16 in the Sports product group seems unusual at first, the primary reason is that very few products were in scope.
- In the example case, only 16 products were included in the results on the analysis date.

These products were likely:

- Out of stock for a long time, or
- Had very low or no sales activity

In such low-data scenarios, the system assigns a default target of 1 to prevent treating demand as zero.
This default value appears as the min target in the data.

### min_dos_client vs min_dos

- The minimum target value is determined by the Minimum Weeks Cover parameter defined by the client via the UI.
- In the system, this is represented as min_dos.Example: If the client wants a minimum stock cover of 5 weeks, this equals 35 days.The system calculates the average forecast over 35 days and sets this as the minimum target.

### What Is Presentation Stock and How Is It Defined?

`presentation_stock` is the minimum stock quantity required for a product to be visibly displayed on store shelves.

- Ideally, the target value should not fall below the presentation_stock value.
- It can be defined via the UI, and UI input takes precedence over any internal definitions.

Since this parameter is client-facing and editable via the UI, the client is expected to know and manage it.

### On Need–Target–SOQ Mismatch for Informal Shoes

- In the Informal Shoes category, the SOQ (Solution Order Quantity) share appeared high in analysis (28.68%).
- Such discrepancies typically relate to supply availability.

> If the available supply for Informal Shoes can fully cover the demand,the system may allocate more SOQ to this group,resulting in a higher SOQ share than Need.

- Usually, Target and Need values are expected to be similar since Target is derived from:ForecastSafety StockPresentation Stock
- However, SOQ is directly limited by available supply, so it's not always proportional to Need or Target.
